website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, pressure-mounted metal gate from a reputable company.
pros: Sturdy metal with a triple lock system
cons: Requires tightening more often than some owners would like

customer_reviews.title: Great gate, works well with two for a cat barrier.
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these to stack on top of each other as a cat gate in our rental where we couldn't put holes in the walls. The top is upside down, so the two gates meet at the handles. It's easy to open, just squeeze the two gates together! We also own two of the shorter of these gates. Love them all! It's particularly great that they open both ways.
customer_reviews.author: iridescentfire

customer_reviews.title: Damages walls and bannisters. Stick to screw-in.
customer_reviews.text: We put up with this inconvenient step-over gate for three weeks. In that short time, its mandatory adhesive wall cups literally tore the paint off the wall in one place, and permanently marred the other place. There’s no point to pressure-mounted baby gates like this that are likely to damage your wall about as bad as a screw would. (See pics) Secondly, beware that a disturbing amount of pressure is needed to bend the top into shape. It pushed against our historic house’s bannister hard enough to cause cracks and permanent outward deformation. 2 stars because this North States gate is easy to lift up and swing open with one finger, self-closes with gravity power, and is available in white.
customer_reviews.author: W. Tersch

customer_reviews.title: Our Little Gated Community
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep our chihuahuas downstairs, away from the kittens litter box. One of the dogs is a turd smuggler. This was very easy to install! We put ours on the landing between the first and second floor, to reduce any possibility of tripping. Our cats can all jump over it, which is fine, but they seem to prefer to have their humans open it for them. If you don't open the gate to its full extension, it automatically shuts itself.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Best baby gate we've tried.
customer_reviews.text: The 'Easy-Close Gate' is the best baby gate we've tried (about 4 different ones in total). It is well made, easy to assemble, and convenient to operate. It appears like it will hold up well - we'll see. I particularly like that its designed to stay in place (the user walks through a swinging gate with easy one-hand operation). We installed it with 'Wall-Nanny Baby Gate Wall Protectors' and have experienced no wall damage. I'd recommend those as well. We'd buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: DaveF

customer_reviews.title: NOT kid proof
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is good and it's easy to install however none of that matters if you are using this for a child over the age of 13 or so months. Our 18 month old child can easily push the gate up and open it , even if the twist lock is secured. Buy the type where a button has to pushed with your thumb while lifting a lever to open the gate. This design is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy G

customer_reviews.title: Great but Auto Close stops working
customer_reviews.text: This fence is great, study, looks good and is tall. I bought 3 and Auto close stopped working on all of them after about a week. Not that I relied on the auto close anyway, I always double check the gate but was a bit disappointed by it. Otherwise this gate has been a good purchase. The wall nanny's work with it, i bought the mini ones,but it does come with some plastic wall protectors. It stays open when pushed all the way back both ways and swings out both ways.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for stairs
customer_reviews.text: The product itself seemed ok but I did not think it was safe to have at the stairs so returned it. It closes itself, but swinging shut and latching on the knob sticking out at the bottom. To lock it you then turn the lock at the top. To open was the worry I had. There is nothing that unlatches the knob from the bottom, so when I un-turn the lock at the top I have to pull the door up from the knob and then open it. On stairs, holding my young niece I didn't want to do that. I want a door that I just push a button or switch a latch that will unlock the door.
customer_reviews.author: Silent Voice

customer_reviews.title: Bronze color is different now.
customer_reviews.text: First of all these gates are wonderful. I use them to keep my special needs son safe. Don’t want him turning on the stove or anything like that. This is my fourth one. I bought three a few years ago and they were a dark brown color which was called bronze. Now my new one is a charcoal, also called bronze. So they don’t match, but close enough I guess. Just a little disappointing. Both colors are fine but the OCD in me is screaming inside, hahaha. I’ll get over it. They are superior gates though. My son is eight and he can’t open them.
customer_reviews.author: luvmykai

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but not a quick install.
customer_reviews.text: The gate is very durable and seems like it will last a long time. My complaint with it is the set up. If you plan on leaving this gate in place for long periods of time, great. But if it's something you may want to remove periodically you will find that because the gate appears to be bent (which is normal) it requires alot of force on the adjusters to install it correctly. They even include a small spanner type wrench to adjust it. You have to use that because it takes alot of force to straighten it out. Its not like one of those wooden gates that has basically one adjustment and you simply latch it in place.
customer_reviews.author: D Walker

customer_reviews.title: FLIMSY
customer_reviews.text: I would probably trust this for a puppy, or maybe to keep a baby out of a living room if I didn't want him spilling cheerios in there... But I would definitely not trust this thing to keep my baby away from the stairs. It's flimsy and clumsy to install, and the side pieces (which, by the way, there aren't enough included in the box for it to reach its advertised maximum width) just attach with some little metal pins. So if you have two hands and need to hold 4 side pieces onto this thing while maneuvering it into position, good luck.
customer_reviews.author: chrisazonian

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am so surprised by how much I actually like this baby gate. I fully expected it to be a huge (though necessary) eyesore and a total pain to use. It’s neither! We aren’t damaging our woodwork, it feels super secure, and it was fairy easy to install. It opens in either direction and it locks open at a certain point so it’s not always banging against the wall or swinging around. Our 2.5 year old hasn’t figured out how to open it yet but we’ve found it super easy to use. I’d totally recommend it to anyone looking for an alternative to gates that require you to screw something into the wall or your banister.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Stratmeyer

customer_reviews.title: At first I was like 😑 and then I was like 😁
customer_reviews.text: At first, I had issues with the latch not properly closing and my fue babies getting out (totally my fault). I made sure I kept evenly turning the tension knobs until the gap between the door and the latch on the other side were making contact (without it getting stuck). It won’t break, and you can keep turning this with the wrench provided. This is a great gate and I highly recommend, as my fur babies are properly secured without pushing their way out. FYI just watch the video on how to install and use the mounting cups, as they make a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: M Miller

customer_reviews.title: Highly satisfied!! Works perfectly as described, self closing mechanism is excellent, study enough!
customer_reviews.text: After trying out a hardware mount gate and having no luck with it, this gate is the answer I was looking for to contain my mini Aussie who was getting used to his new adopted house and loved to rip stuff when he had his zoomies! We were able to contain him perfectly with this awesome, easy to install pet gate. Although the gate says a max length of 38.5, my doorway opening is about 39.5 without the baseboard and I had no issues fitting this gate and tightening the screws (though I might have pushed it to its limits but it is still a snug fit). I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: MRP

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two gates... one came in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two gates...one came in the brand name box, inside a plain cardboard box. This tall one came in a large plastic bag in a plain cardboard box. Turns out it's been pieced together... the gate itself is one shade of color while the extensions (which we need to use) are a much darker shade. Big deal? Not really. But when you're paying for a NEW item it should be NEW....and not a hobbled together form of what you're expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase for puppy
customer_reviews.text: We've got a puppy, and for his first two months here, he'd slip past the old style gate we had up. He figured out how to nose past it, and get downstairs, to chew on my daughter's toys and chew on the computer cables in my office. Then we bought this. It's excellent! Bars are close enough that he can't slip through. Sturdy construction, so he can't slam against it, and you can't accidentally knock it out of place. Easy enough to open and close for most adults (yep, most... no, I won't tell you who struggles, but it was funny... and there is no reason they should have... unintended intelligence test of sorts).
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: Poor product if you have baseboards or moldings/trim
customer_reviews.text: Poor product if you have baseboards or moldings/trim. It would require the extension to fit on the top, but the bottom would not fit with extension. This is a standard builder baseboard too, nothing special. Unusable in a safe manner as a result.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I got this to keep the dog out of the cat's room, and away from the litter box and her food. It installed easily, it's very sturdy and functions smoothly and easily. I didn't need the extensions, so I can't say anything about those. It doesn't have a 'pet door' in it like some, but the cat can jump it easily, much to the dog's frustration. It opens by gently lifting up on the gate and it opens in both directions. There is a simple twist lock on the top of the gate that can be used for extra security, but the gate stays closed and latched fine without using it.
customer_reviews.author: DogMom

customer_reviews.title: Solid baby gate but won't work in door frame with lever door handles.
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy and very easy to install. Got the taller ones because my two year old was climbing over regular accordion style baby gates. However I hadn't anticipated that these will interfere with lever door handles when mounted in a door frame. So keep that in mind, if you're mounting in a door frame get the shorter one. Toddler can't climb over either of them becuase there's no foothold like the accordion style.
customer_reviews.author: adamg

customer_reviews.title: Easy for a 4 year old to open
customer_reviews.text: We needed a gate which our 4 year old could open but could keep our 1 year old out. My 4 year old can lift up on the door and get it open. She hasn’t quite figured out the lock. This gate also swings closed on its own if it’s not opened all the way. I like that it can also stay open. The tall version is perfect for doorway because you don’t have to bend over to open it. In my opinion, this is the perfect gate for a high traffic area.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: We Ordered for Puppies.
customer_reviews.text: We are using this for puppies, our puppies are still small enough to fit through, but it won't be long. I like it because it did not have rungs that they could climb up, I find that the gate locking mechanism is very easy to use. It is very sturdy. Note that although the puppies are small enough to get through the bars, we are keeping it because we can see use when they get bigger and it is so nicely made.
customer_reviews.author: Design-Inspired

customer_reviews.title: Gates is sturdy may need re tightening of screws after 6 months or so.
customer_reviews.text: Helping keep the kids away from kitchen. Maybe after 6-8 months you will need to re adjust screws to make sure the alignments is not lost from all the slamming, bagging, and jumping the kids will do. If you do install gate with a 1” gap or greater from the finish floor expect people to trip when door is open. People misjudge height and never raise legs high enough to clear a raise gate. If gate is flush with the floor the tripping will minimize to only your kids trippping when they are running through it if the gates are left accidentally open.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gate for a dog. He pushed on the gate and it falls apart. I put it in a different location so I wouldn't need to use the extenders and it did the same thing. He is not jumping on it he just pushed it with his nose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baby can escape unless
customer_reviews.text: We've had this gate for 7 months now and our 15 month old figured out how to open the gate. There are two lock types on the gate on that is a quick lock and the other is more tricky. The easy gate lock is very easy for a toddler to open so in order to keep the kid from getting through the gate you need to constantly keep closing the more cumbersome gate lock which sort of makes the gate just annoying to operate every time you go in an out of it. I wouldn't recommend this gate and I'm actually back on Amazon looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: jcal812

customer_reviews.title: Solid structure, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the top of the stairs leading to our basement (no door) to keep dogs out of the den down there. It was so simple and quick to install by myself. I used the mounts with adhesive so that we didn't have permanent marks on the frame (hoping to install door eventually). It's held up to our 60-80 lbs dogs bumping into it. It'd also simple enough for our 6 and 9 year olds to open themselves. Noise of it latching isn't that bad, it doesn't bother us. It hasn't ever over shot while closing as anther reviewer commented. Happy with this purchase! Im planing to buy a second for the upstairs when baby starts crawling!
customer_reviews.author: Wisco Mama

customer_reviews.title: High quality, easy to install & operate. Perfect for pets.
customer_reviews.text: High Marks: -well made, sturdy -excellent engineering -swings both directions -stays open in either direction -closes/latches easily, simple push with hand or foot and gate closed by itself. -easy open, don't need locking option for pet -easy assembly/installation -Are there cheaper gates, yes. Are there better gates, no. -fits 36" door -narrow width between bars, nothing but kittens or really small pets can get between bars
customer_reviews.author: Rae B. Faltysek

customer_reviews.title: easy in and out and attractive
customer_reviews.text: I love this gate - it is so easy to walk through. However, it is not convenient if you need to move it once installed. It took two of us to install it and two of us to remove it because of all the pieces. If it is going to be placed and left, it is wonderful and 5 stars. If it needs to be moved around like I need, it isn't a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: JLS

customer_reviews.title: It is not easy to get all 4 bumpers aligned just right
customer_reviews.text: This is a balky item to install. It is not easy to get all 4 bumpers aligned just right. The wrench used to tighten the bumpers to the wall fits poorly and the process becomes tedious. Then the adhesives used to attach the bumpers to the wall peeled paint right off the wall. The bumper protectors listed by amazon as "frequently bought together" don't fit the bumpers, which would have been nice in allowing you to protect the paint on your wall. The instructions for locking and for opening the gate are unclear. Build quality seems good, on the other hand.
customer_reviews.author: mtparis

customer_reviews.title: Not an eyesore
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Easy to install but make sure to read instructions. I used this with the *Wall Nanny Minni*. Love that it has a gate door and do not need to take down to pass thru. I got these to split the house with my dog. She has half of the house and our other dog that visits us almost every day gets the other half.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Q.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Took us a minute to get it together but it's been great ever since. I actually bought it to keep my dogs out of the office room. The only room in the house with carpet that we don't want them to destroy!! They're sad about it but oh well lol. It opens kinda weird since you have to push a button from under the handle and then pull upwards? But everything is working just fine with it. Seems pretty durable and I like the fact that it comes with an adhesive option if you don't want to screw it into your walls
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my use
customer_reviews.text: I needed a gate to keep my dog in the kitchen for a short time in the morning when he's home alone. the rest of the time we didn't want to have to use hands to open it when our hands our full in/out of the kitchen. they stay open function works perfectly. my dog is only 25 lbs so it keeps him in nicely with just the pressure cups. it does have an option to screw it into the walls as well but we didn't need to do that.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: My kids can't break it!
customer_reviews.text: This gate has been kicked, slammed, hung on, and fallen into over and over again every day. I have 2 children, 4 y.o. and 18 months, and I watch 2 additional children, 20 months and 3 y.o., full time. They have put this gate through hell and it has upheld! The hinges that connect to the wall keep the screws from being yanked of the wall. It is sturdy and basically indestructible. I recommend to anyone looking for a strong gate!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Boullie

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well designed, and functional gate!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally do not need to hop over previous gate every time. Love that it opens either way and stays open if you open the gate wide, or swings closed when you open it to just go through. This is helpful when we want to keep our 2 dogs in the room, and not follow us when carrying stuff in our arms.
customer_reviews.author: Meotoole

customer_reviews.title: A curious one year old is no match!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these gates to block off the kitchen from my curious one year old who was getting into everything. Installation wasn't bad, I tackled both gates in maybe 30 minutes total. I love the fact that the gates can open either direction and the locking open feature is fantastic as well so we can leave the gates open when the little one is asleep and we don't have to mess with them. I would highly recommend these gates. Also I don't know if it is advertised or not but these gates do close on their own (unless locked open).
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Beware open box!
customer_reviews.text: I know it's "open box" but if it says "very good" or above ... Heck even "acceptable" I expect it to be at minimum in working condition. There is no latch at the top so it just swings free. What is the point of having it then?? 100% not acceptable. See photos of what the gate is SUPPOSED to look vs what was delivered to us.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Kamerad

customer_reviews.title: Buying a second one tonight
customer_reviews.text: We discovered that our antique home has asymmetric door frames when we tried to use cheaper pressure gates. This one allowed us to adjust each of the 4 pressure points individually, so the gate can be fit to the unique shape of each doorway. It took a minute (or 5) to figure out how to actually open the door once installed, but now our 7 year old can pass through without a problem. He is happy our 9 month twins can't get into his room and toys. The gate door can be locked open, so it isn't a fire hazard at night.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: We are very happy with this gate.
customer_reviews.text: After stepping over a wooden baby gate for the last 6 months, this gate is a lifesaver! Based on other gates' reviews, many seemed to have a skinny gate opening to walk through. That is not the case for this one. I'm 8 months pregnant and can walk through this gate carrying groceries without any problems. I especially like that it can open both directions, and can lock into an open position if you open it all the way. But it still closes automatically if you don't push it far enough to lock it. Overall, it's a great gate. If I ever need a second one, I will definitely buy another of these.
customer_reviews.author: Tyree Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended by a Pro!
customer_reviews.text: I use these gates professionally, I board dogs in a cage-free house, albeit sometimes having the need to "sort" them in separate rooms for feeding. This is, hands down, the best gate I have come across, so far and I will certainly add more to the two that I already possess. The first one is a year old, has endured a lot of rambunctious dogs, some of them truly large and energetic, and it shows zero signs of wear and tear. Read the instructions, install it properly, and you will be happy with it. p.s.: Disregard ludicrous reviews from people that fail to read or fail to install the gate correctly, this is a superb product!
customer_reviews.author: S K

customer_reviews.title: No complaints! Take the plunge.
customer_reviews.text: When you take it out of the box, the weld makes the bar looks so crooked. I was thinking there was no way the door would function against that funky side bar, but it turns out, once you tighten it within your wall/entry, it straightens itself out to make the door secure. The pull back & lift up motion to open the door is a little stiff right now, but I think it will get easier with more use. I love the locking mechanism for the door. Also, when I swing one way it stays open, and the other way auto-shuts it. I appreciate the options there!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory I

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and easy to use effectively
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 different gates. This one was the easiest to put up (really easy). It is also easy to use because you just pull up to open it (not a lot of dexterity required), it is easy to get it in the "open" position, and if not it closes on its own so one less thing to think about. The opening is small, which is what we needed for where we put it, but that could be a factor for some locations.
customer_reviews.author: Chani

customer_reviews.title: A Couple Changes Get to 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and install. Screws were too short for finding anything beyond sheet rock. They need a tighter coupling method with the side extensions, its close but a tad loose. Like the door latch, swing will. Day one so we'll see about longevity.
customer_reviews.author: DZM

customer_reviews.title: Good solid gate
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason this gate has such a high rating -- it's easy to install, sturdy, and easy to operate one-handed. We opted to use the adhesive-backed cups to secure it rather than screw into the trim. With the tension bars adjusted, it feels as though it can survive a good deal of pressure without budging. We actually caught our friend's 4-year-old swinging from the gate and it didn't move, bend, etc. Opening is easy with one hand and the gate swings both ways, which is a nice touch. It's also low enough that my wife (she's 5'2") and I can step over it without opening, but high enough for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Ed BTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Cured what steroids couldn't!
customer_reviews.text: My dermatologist prescribed me a topical steroid for what she thought was "Seborrhoeic dermatitis" of the scalp. After trying the steroid without success for a couple weeks, I tried this shampoo. It cleared up the condition (whatever it was!) after one wash! I continued washing with only this shampoo/conditioner until they were gone without ever having a flair up of the oily scalp problem. I can now use regular shampoos again with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Looks great ! Wish it came with stairs adapters
customer_reviews.text: I had issues installing it at first, but customer services and other amazon customers helped me resolve the issues. The gap between the lock ended up closing perfectly as I tightened the screws. One thing I didn’t like is the product doesn’t come with stairs adapter, I had to go and buy them on amazon for another $15 to be able to install correctly.
customer_reviews.author: HK.

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: For $67 I was expecting something way more sturdy but if you push against the gate at the slightest (toddler) the extensions bend inward. I definitely would not have bought this gate
customer_reviews.author: allie wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality, insecure pressure mounting
customer_reviews.text: Out-of-the-box, this gate looks really nice and has a high build quality. The door opening and closing mechanism is really solid. The only problem is the pressure-mounting option. It just doesn't work that well. I was hoping to avoid drilling into the very nice 100-year-old banister in my home by using a pressure-mounted gate. The pressure-mounting just isn't secure enough to hold up to a child pulling on it. Maybe it's because I had to use the extensions at maximum width, but plenty of hallways are wide enough to require that. If you plan to drill into the walls or you have narrow opening to block, then this gate is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: 5 Ideas

customer_reviews.title: This door is so great. I used to have to climb over the ...
customer_reviews.text: This door is so great. I used to have to climb over the old fashion one. My whole family fits through the open latched gate now with out all the tripping and falling. Find the YouTube video to install it. Use the cheap wrenches they provide to tighten the claps, they look cheap but actually work and make tightening faster and easier. You want to keep tightening the clasps until the door actually closes. To open the door, youll actually lift the door and turn the small nozel.
customer_reviews.author: Sab Polly

customer_reviews.title: Great Baby Gate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gate to keep my granddaughter from climbing the stairs, it works great and was so easy to install, I highly recommend this. It took a little bit to get it screwed in so that the top of the gate closed but once I did that it works great! Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pbrave

customer_reviews.title: Great gate for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this gate. I had one previously that a family member disposed of because they saw it when it was not mounted and thought it was broken. I was very happy to find this gate on amazon so I could reorder it. It locks, and swings either in or out, and my favorite feature is that the gate pauses when fully open so you can choose to leave the door open. No swinging and banging shut every time you walk through. I use this primarily to keep the dog out of a single room for my old cat to have privacy. If you are using it with children the pause feature might not be so desirable.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Fae

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 year old son struggles somewhat to open it when he’s coming and going so it’s not super easy to open but for adults it’s quick and easy. Love that it stays open or closes on its own. Perfect for keeping our 1 year old out of trouble!
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: 17 month old can defeat this
customer_reviews.text: I have this placed at the bottom of the stairs. Issue is that the tension rod does not get right enough and toddlers (17 mo) can spin the nuts and defeat the gate. The locking mechanism is not very difficult to open either. I had to use super glue to lock the spinning nuts in place which is ridiculous. Not a fan and wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: tiffanymamone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gate for a narrow hallway or door opening
customer_reviews.text: We just purchased this gate to put across the door to our 1/2 bath. We needed a place to feed the smaller of our two dogs because Jake (the bigger male) will eat the little dog's food if she doesn't have protection. The gate is made extremely well and functioned perfectly upon installation. It took me about 15 minutes to install the gate including the two small (and included) outside sections. My door opening is 36 inches and this gate could not be better. Aside from the gate being very well made, the gate opens to the inside or the outside. It also has a hold open feature that keeps the gate from automatically closing once opened.
customer_reviews.author: P C Z

customer_reviews.title: It broke waaaaaay too soon and for no reason.
customer_reviews.text: I would write a not so bad review last month, but the gate just broke and I have been using it for only 2 months. My son is 1 y.o. and this gate was installed on top of the stairs, so yeah... unacceptable that it broke so easily. Yesterday I noticed that it seemed kind of loose and I realized the little pin that sticks out that "clicks" and keeps the gate closed was broken. Now the gate is VERY easily opened. Not safe at all!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install, and very sturdy once we set it up. Our baby is standing and over 20 lbs and holds onto/puts her full weight on the gate daily with no problem. I even accidentally crashed into the gate with my 150 lb body at walking speed and it didn't budge an inch! (My leg and ego got bruised though.) If you're installing on drywall, wallsavers are a MUST. The amount of pressure it would put on the wall would otherwise punch a hole.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The gate is crazy sturdy and perfect to keep our furrbabies separated since they, unfortunately, like to fight. We started with one, and after a year we’ve got three of these gates strategically placed to make our lives, and theirs, easier.
customer_reviews.author: LAMB

customer_reviews.title: Not secure enough
customer_reviews.text: It worked until our little one figured out how to open it at 20 months. It was easy for us to open and just swing shut behind us, so it was convenient and easier to go through than our other baby gates that you have to latch behind you. However, the trade off was that it wasn't as secure when faced with a clever & motivated munchkin. I will have to purchase and install a new gate. This gate might work well if using it for a short time or just for small dogs or something.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: This gate does not self latch - defective
customer_reviews.text: Defective product. After spending 2 hours making sure everything was lined up and that there was proper tension, I read reviews where other people who purchased the gate after 2016 had the same complaint: the gate doesn’t self latch. It swings closes, but the bottom peg that’s supposed to slide in and the top latch both don’t catch, so the gate just bounces when it swings shut. Really a shame, but I’m probably just the victim of fake reviews meant to boost the overall rating of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: After a while, it doesn't close so well. It gradually becomes easier to open and before you notice your kid leans on it and it opens up and he falls off the stairs. Plus, it narrows the way by about 40% so you can't past through carrying things. And, it's really not that easy to operate. Guests are always getting stuck. But these are minor things. The main thing is that it's just not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Shany Ishiahu

customer_reviews.title: This gate is very easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: This gate is very easy to set up and use. I had no trouble setting it up by myself while baby was playing downstairs in the Northgate Superyard. It's sturdy, seems durable, and the door is simple to open. You just lift and swing open either way. It stays open if you push it all the way. The gate comes out of the box looking askew as other reviewers have mentioned. You need to tighten it against the wall and it will be completely straight. The door will align with the rest of the gate. Works perfectly at the top of our stairs in our loft.
customer_reviews.author: jenk

customer_reviews.title: Not for small pups
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this item 4 stars as it is sturdy and very easy to install. I love the fact that it has a door that can be opened and closed easily. I put this up in 5 minutes, put my pup on the other side and then fell down laughing as she squirmed through the rails. She is just so tiny (3 llbs) that this just does not work to contain her. If it worked for me I would have given the product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, Easy to Use and Assemble, and Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: Love! Great product, easy to use and assemble, comes with two additional pieces for slightly wider spaces, works very well, and best of all... keeps my littles safe from roaming around into our “less baby proofed” areas in our home. Love the option of being able to leave it open, either way, as well!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: An excellent gate. We needed a pet gate that would be semi-permanently installed, easy to use, and not ugly. This gate is everything everyone said it was. My older kids had no trouble learning to open it. The walk-though is wide enough for most people. Easy to leave open, auto-closes properly. An installation note: There's a big note on the packaging that says the gate may appear bent before installation. In our case it looked like the latch had a huge gap and would never close. DON'T PANIC, KEEP INSTALLING: this corrects itself upon installation. We got ours from Amazon Warehouse as an opened box, which saved us a little money.
customer_reviews.author: Calthine

customer_reviews.title: easy to open and close by adults
customer_reviews.text: Used it with wall nanny on the bottom of our stairs. Didn't want to drill holes in our new home. my 2 year old climbs and pulls on it but it doesnt budge. easy to open and close by adults. But my toddler and older 4 years old kids who visited us could not open it. I like that it stays open if u want and can be easily opened with one hand while carrying our toddler. Very good quality. used it with the extensions it came with.
customer_reviews.author: SaRa

customer_reviews.title: Exactly whatweI needed
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product, no more having to step over the old plastic/wood gates. Bought two of them and had both of them Installed in about 15 minutes. Make sure to read the instructions as you might think they are bent at first... that is just the way they are shipped. When you tighten the top part it closes the gap. My only gripe is that I wished they sold them with a little wider gate opening but without the pet door.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Foster

customer_reviews.title: Installs and works as expected with no "gap" problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these gates despite some negative reviews and reported installation problems. Happily, assembly and installation was straightforward and much simpler than many comments suggested. There was no gap as reported from 31.5-32.5; two gates fit perfectly in 32" door widths. The third went easily into a 35" opening. Opening the gate is easy, and it automatically swings back and latches automatically. The gate can also be left open in a fixed position. This is a good product and met all of my expectations. I don't give 5 stars unless a product exceeds expectations. The photo shows the product with the gate in the open position in a 32" door frame.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, but child may learn to open it pretty soon.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and only a little tricky to install. I am worried that my baby may learn to open it pretty soon. Once she can reach the top she just has to turn a knob and then lift the gate to make it open. FYI, most reviewers that gave this product one star appear to have not read the directions. The gate is designed intentionally with a bend that stops the gate from shutting until it is installed. The bend helps ensure adequate pressure against the walls when the gate is correctly installed. At that point it does close properly.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Chaplin

customer_reviews.title: Both of these were open boxes but I had problems ...
customer_reviews.text: Both of these were open boxes but I had problems with both being crooked. The first one the latch wouldn't even touch so the gate didn't stay closed. The second the latch touched but the lock didn't so it worked properly except it didn't lock. Disappointing. The second one we kept and tried for a couple weeks since we were using it for a dog so we didn't really need the locking feature. This doe not claim to be for outdoor use so I can't fault the company, but when we tried it on our deck it rusted within a week.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Strong and attractive gate
customer_reviews.text: This gate replaces another that our new dog was able to defeat. This one is much stronger, looks nicer, closes more easily, and comes with clear instructions on how to fit the space. Ours is at the bottom of a staircase. It's easy for us to get through and strong enough so our new 55-pounds boxer can't pop it open like she did the gate that this one replaces. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and you can open it while holding a child!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a couple months ago and really like it. We use it for the bottom of the stairs. It is sturdy even when our toddler stands at it and shakes it. It has a feature with it swings closed behind you so that helps. Also you can unlock it with one hand which is very helpful when you are carrying a sleeping toddler. We used this gate with a banister adapter and it works perfectly! If you have pets be cautious - one of our cats can fit through the bars but the other (slightly overweight) is not able to. He sits and waits for it to be opened for him.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to setup and works great!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this gate to keep our senior dog out of carpeted areas of the home (she apparently thinks it is inside grass). It works perfectly, and is super simple to set up. I’ve seen a few reviews on here about it being difficult, which I completely disagree with. If you are looking for a gate so easy to setup a five year could do it, at a good value ($$$), and looks nice then go ahead and click the buy button.
customer_reviews.author: EKing708

customer_reviews.title: Great Puppy Blocker
customer_reviews.text: We have a puppy that will ravage just about anything that it can get to (just typical puppy). I bought two of these gates to block access to rooms we don't want her to get into. These gates are pretty easy to install and seem to be very sturdy. I like the stay open or swing closed features. It is also just about the right height to discourage jumping (at least while she is a puppy). All the bars are vertical and there are no horizontal pieces which makes them impossible to climb. Very glad to have found these.
customer_reviews.author: LDW

customer_reviews.title: Nicely constructed, durable material, and the right height for taller humans
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I don’t like bending over to release the small wooden doggy gates. This one is perfect. Once you get it snugged just right between the walls, the easy lift up and push/pull gate releases nicely. Just enough effort releasing with one hand. Be careful showing little ones how to release the door so they don’t push it over. Nicely constructed, durable material, and the right height for taller humans.
customer_reviews.author: Will Irvine

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gate ever and we have tried a few. Well worth the price. Our 18 month old does like to shake it and it has loosened a few times. If we check the tightness each day we are all happy! We have it on a stairway and the way it connects for us is on the second step. Gives her a little place to sit on the first step.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, nice addition to decor
customer_reviews.text: It had to be sturdy and tall, not a chewing distraction, and look nice. We purchased to block the entrance to the kitchen. It’s tall enough to stop our jumping Pitty, sturdy enough to hold her weight when standing against it and pretty enough to blend with decor. Easy to install in doorway, stay open feature is great and when it’s locked it won’t budge. Would purchase again. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CCombs

customer_reviews.title: I then went out shopping and purchased an Evenflo which I absolutely love. The difference between the two is that Evenflo ...
customer_reviews.text: 'Had a hard time deciding how many stars to rate this. The gate itself seems sturdy--if you can get it set up correctly. The instructions are not all that clear. I wound up returning it because the gate itself seemed out of whack. I then went out shopping and purchased an Evenflo which I absolutely love. The difference between the two is that Evenflo explained the construction of the gate and its insertion into the doorway more explicitly. Now I'm not sure if this gate was defective or if had to do with the crumby instructions.
customer_reviews.author: bev

customer_reviews.title: Well made and works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for my kitchen to keep the puppy in and very happy with my purchase. Works great and does exactly what it's supposed to. Looks are just okay but they're not going to be there permanently so I can ignore that. I recommend these especially for a puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Jathpuh's mama

customer_reviews.title: Good gate
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so far, I’ve had it for a couple months, and it’s a good gate for keeping my dogs out of the laundry room.... only one star off because you really need to use the screw in cups in the doorway if it’s an area that is used often otherwise the ends shift and keep needing to be moved back. Otherwise it’s worked great so far. May update the review if anything changes in the next few months.
customer_reviews.author: D JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, very good against strong kids lol
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a mini-Hulk, hate she grabs fate she screws. This one have been a great addition for baby proofing our house, kinda un breakable, sturdy, and easy to open for an adult. I totally recommend it for frame doors, you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've bought. Works great on my porch. Easy to get out and in. Easy installation. My dogs do not try to jump over or get out of it. Would purchase another if ever needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Stockton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiest gate
customer_reviews.text: I've bought three of these gates because I love them so much. The first I bought over 3 years ago and would have still worked except parts of it got lost in a move. So when my second child started crawling everywhere I knew exactly which gate to buy. It is super easy to put up and fits many different sized entries. I like the locking feature for the door.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: hard to open the doors compared to my other safety gates
customer_reviews.text: its pretty sturdy and easy to install but the doors not the smoothest door compared to my other safty gates. it had turn lock system which may be good if the gate is for toddlers. i would probably purchase a different gate next time tho
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great for chihuahua
customer_reviews.text: I went through two other gates before I found this one. My dog is a jumper and a climber so the extra height was really appreciated. One gate I bought had large gaps in the bars where the extensions went and she was able to squeeze right through, but this one had no such problems. The extensions are kind of flimsy where they attach to the gate; not a problem for me but for use with a child I could imagine it may be one. Also, as some other reviewers have mentioned, the packaging is pretty bad. The box was torn open when it arrived, but luckily nothing was missing.
customer_reviews.author: hanah

customer_reviews.title: Very good product that could have been even better.
customer_reviews.text: Overall product quality is very good and comes with extensions. Very secure.and sturdy. Installation easy unless your opening is very close to the maximum width dimension of each configuration iteration, as was my scenario. To remedy this issue I installed one side with the knurled adjustment nuts removed.and the spreader bolts cut shorter. (this is necessary as the extension mounting dowels prevent the spreader bolt to be fully inserted even with the knurled ring nut absent.I called the manufacturer's customer service to recommend including two shorter bolts for these situations. Service rep didn't really seem interested in my call (or hadn't finished her first cup of coffee).
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great gate so far
customer_reviews.text: Great gate so far. Others have posted about how the top latch does not meet at the top: READ THE DIRECTIONS THAT ARE SLAPPED ON THE PACKAGE THAT CLEARLY STATES THE LATCH WILL COME TOGETHER WHEN TIGHTENED. Seriously, it comes together perfectly once you have the nobs tightened ALL THE WAY. Love the color of bronze gate. Easy to open. Will close and stay closed even without the top latch locked. Only had the gate up a few days so will see how it holds up. Glad i didn't listen to all the bad reviews and gave it a try.
customer_reviews.author: A R S

customer_reviews.title: Great gate! Nice quality!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this gate for our living room. We like to keep my toddler isolated to this area. I am overall happy with the gate. However, I notice it doesn't pressure mount totally secure all the time. After some time, it loosens and has to be resecurred. I do love being able to open the gate to walk through. Before, we were stepping over a gate. This makes life so much easier and we should have done it sooner. Great gate for the price!
customer_reviews.author: haley Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I want
customer_reviews.text: I like this gate. It is easy to open with one hand. It swings in either direction. It will stay open if you push it all the way open, otherwise it will close on its own.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Love this gate
customer_reviews.text: This gate has stood the test of time! It has been installed at the top of our very steep staircase for over 2 years now and has never budged. My 3 year old still has no idea how to open it and I feel very safe with it in place. It is self-closing 95% of the time--that other 5% of the time you have to pull it closed. And the only problem I have with it is maneuvering my laundry basket over it/through it, but that just goes along with having a gate at the top of the stairs. Love this gate, it has never given us issues and it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Maria French

customer_reviews.title: I put in the four pressure cups and squeeze in to the 28" space that I have and it fits exactly so very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: it came one piece installed, if you don't need the extension. I put in the four pressure cups and squeeze in to the 28" space that I have and it fits exactly so very happy with it. It seems sturdy. Although it is a bit expensive than the other gates, it is one of the few gates out there that fits 28'. They even delivered on Sunday so even better!
customer_reviews.author: Teddi

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Convenient Baby Gate
customer_reviews.text: Excellent baby/pet gate. It works well, opening easily and closing automatically, although it will remain open if pushed all the way open. It does make a metallic sound when closing automatically, which might be important if someone is a light sleeper. My handyman installed it, so I can't speak to the ease of installation.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara F.

customer_reviews.title: Quality gate at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these gates protecting my stairs for my kids for close to 3 years . I did reinforce them by adding a piece of wood on the wall side and used heavy duty zip ties. When I originally ordered them and went to install them there was a large gap like to see some people are posting "terrible gates" this is easily fixed by just adjusting the top screws tighter it will close the gap. I defiantly would recommend these gates they have been opened and closed thousands of times. The only thing is once a month or every two months I recommend making sure the adjustment screws are still tight.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 year old can open easily
customer_reviews.text: The gate was easy to install and I liked that it's got an "extra" locking feature. However, after about a week or two, our toddler figured out that with enough back and forth manipulation and tons of pushing it will open right up. Takes her less than a minute now.
customer_reviews.author: MMoynihan

customer_reviews.title: Great Gate
customer_reviews.text: Great baby gate and easy to install. We are using at the top of our stairs and it works perfectly. I love that it shuts on its own when walking through, or you can extend all the way to leave open.
customer_reviews.author: Alli Z

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, sturdy, well made. Easy assembly. I bought this and also the Regalo Easy Step Walk Thru Gate for another doorway. No comparison! Yes, this one costs a bit more, but so worth it. Quality of the two are quite different, this one much better. I have brusied myself on a sharp edge of the regalo twice! (When I get around to doing a review on that page will post the picture of the gate's edge--I will not put it up again and risk harm to children. This is heavier, sturdier, opens in both directions, has more adaptability to doorway width, and is safer on many fronts.
customer_reviews.author: A.T.

customer_reviews.title: The self-swing back feature is very nice.
customer_reviews.text: The gate is high which makes it easy to open when carrying other items. The self-swing back feature is very nice. Our Lab and Chihuahua do no try and push through the gate so we are ablre to keep it unloack. This means you just need to lift up and swing the gate open which us another nice feature. We are using this gate in the back hall but I wish I had seen this product beore I purchased the two gates at either end of our kitchen. I think these look just as nice, function better since the swing closed on their own and was considerably less expensive. I definately recommend thsi product.
customer_reviews.author: Tony V

customer_reviews.title: Good in the beginning
customer_reviews.text: When I first installed these gates (I bought 2), they were a dream. Stayed open if you 'set them' to & closed & latched automatically behind you. After almost 6 months of use, I notice the gates don't latch anymore. They do close, but since it doesn't latch, really doesn't serve the purpose as we have to be mindful to pull the gate all the way closed to engage the latch to keep them closed. I secured them to my walls so I'm pretty much stuck with them, just disappointed as I had hoped they're 'closing & latching completely' would have lasted a little longer than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lazaro

customer_reviews.title: The handle is difficult.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the North States Industries Superyard 3 in 1 Metal Gate several months ago, and was very satisfied with that product. Knowing how much I loved it, we were looking for a smaller gate for the hall and found this one. I was excited to get it, but once we installed it, it was nothing like their other product. Most dissapointing thing was the handle. It not a simple click and pull up, its a difficult handle to open. You have to slide it to the side, and wiggle it around, before it will open??? That is the most frustrating thing ever! other then that, its pretty strong and i like the color.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, reliable, durable, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works really well and looks great. Easy to install and easy to remove when you don't need it. The door works really well. I attached the provided round plastic protectors to my wall and floor molding to provide a more flush and sturdy surface against which to mount the gate and to prevent wall damage. One of the other reviewers noted that their gate was bent – note that the gate is designed so that the top mounts are further apart than the bottom mounts. This creates the need outward pressure to hold the top of the gate in place.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M. Haggerty

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy; easy to open.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that kept it from being 5 stars is the bottom bar can be a tripping hazard. I don't know how one would get around that and still keep it sturdy unless it was perhaps a bit more "low profile" in the entry area portion of the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Joycelyn Craft

customer_reviews.title: Good gate
customer_reviews.text: I like this gate. It's the only baby gate I've bought for my house. It's pretty easy to install, and it's nice and sturdy. I really appreciate that it's metal. But I can tell that it will require periodic tightening now that my son understands that it's there to block his path.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gate!!
customer_reviews.text: This gate is the BEST!!! I had just took pictures of this gate so I couid order another one, then I found this order summary while viewing my recent orders. This gate is sturdy, a nice dark steel grey color. It's easy to open and close. It's placed in a doorway in our home that is used constantly!! This gate is a must have! Can not go wrong with this product! A+ order it with no concerns, YOU will love this one. A Fish Florida
customer_reviews.author: A. Fish

customer_reviews.title: Love this gate
customer_reviews.text: This was our favorite baby gate. Our doors are old and some aren't squared so some gates wouldn't fit right. The way this one adjust it worked perfect! It can be locked so they can't open it. Very easy for adults to open and close and lock when needed. Our cats and small dog could still get through the larger spaces. We weren't using them for that reason though. The door can prop open to stay open if needed. We bought several for our home.
customer_reviews.author: JennyW

product_meta.title: Toddleroo by North States 38.5” Wide Easy Close Baby Gate: Sturdy Safety gate with one Hand Operation. Pressure Mount. Fits 28-38.5” Wide. (29" Tall, Soft White)
product_meta.description: Size:29" Tall| Color:WhiteYour precious tot needs a safe space to play, and the Toddleroo by North States Easy Close Gate is a breeze to handle. It shuts firmly yet easily with one simple push, keeping your child near the toys and fun but away from harm. The crisp white finish of this pressure mounted gate will stylishly blend with any home décor while its solidly constructed from the highest-quality materials to withstand rigorous day in, day out use. The gate swings open both ways for added convenience and offers a triple locking system for peace of mind. To keep the gate open for multiple pass-through, simply use the hold-open feature to prevent the gate from closing. It's handy for all those times you have to pass through with a baby on the hip. The gate pressure mounts easily by using tension knobs to secure the gate in place. Ideal for a variety of room openings or at the bottom of stairs measuring 28 to 38.5 inches wide with two extensions included and is 29 inches high. Need to make the gate wider? The Easy Close Baby Gate has two additional extensions (sold separately) that will expand the pressure mounted gate up to 62.25 inches wide. The 7 inch extension is available under product number 4994 and the 10.5 inch extension is available under product number 4995.
feature_bullets: NEW NAME - SAME GREAT BRAND YOU TRUST: Worry-free safety! Toddleroo by North States Easy-Close Baby Gate is ideal for a variety of openings. It shuts firmly yet easily with one simple push, keeping your child safe and secure. Safe for babies 6-24 months.

EASY TO INSTALL: Keep your loved ones safe with this pressure mounted gate that's easy to install and doesn't require additional hardware or tools. This baby gate pressure mounts easily by using tension knobs to secure the gate in place, making it safe and secure with no wall damage.
STYLISH AND DEPENDABLE: The exclusive white finish will complement any home decor while its heavy-duty metal construction is built to last!

LOADED WITH CONVENIENT FEATURES: Safety gate swings open both ways for added convenience and offers a triple locking system for peace of mind. To keep the child gate open for multiple pass throughs, simply use the hold-open feature to prevent the gate from closing.

ADJUSTABLE FOR A VARIETY OF SPACES: With two extensions included, this gate can be used in spaces measuring 28 to 38.5 inches wide, gate is 29 inches high. Need a longer gate? No problem! Two additional extensions are sold separately to expand the gate to up to 62.25”

specifications.Safety warning: Check the included instruction manual for a complete list of safety warnings. You will also find the PDF of the manual on the Amazon listing
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,488 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
